review: I own the Fire TV Stick and the Fire TV. Here is a list you may find useful. My conclusion? Had I known what I know now, I would have simply bought a second Fire TV instead of the Stick; however, if budget was a concern, I would get the Stick instead of the Fire TV.- The first thing I noticed about the Stick was that the commercials kind of lie to you through omission about how it connects to your TV. The stick requires power! The package comes with two power options: a USB cable and a wall adapter. The USB cable can be used if the USB port on your TV is powered sufficiently (older USB interfaces won't be sufficient). If the USB doesn't work for you, you can use the wall adapter. The power cable is ugly and plugs into the long side of the Stick and was therefore impossible to hide the cable entirely behind my TV.- The stick doesn't plug into the USB port! It plugs into an HDMI port instead. I wasn't expecting this.- The Fire TV Stick interface isn't as smooth as the Fire TV; the menu animations are a little jittery.- The remote, surprisingly, has a different shape and texture, and the buttons are harder to press than the Fire TV remote.- There is no voice searching on the Stick! I was REALLY sad about this as this feature was a huge selling point for me for the Fire TV.
author: John Durden
